comment.author: 47855139@N03
comment._content: Alert!  The meeting of the waters is in avoca, county wicklow!!!!!!!!!

comment.author: 80294279@N00
comment._content: Maybe there are two meetings of the waters, because there is certainly one in Killarney.

comment.author: 64848937@N00
comment._content: Actually this is the Meeting of the Waters, where the Upper and Lower Lakes meet near Muckross Peninsula.  A wonderful site made even more so by the existence of a superb cake shop nearby.  Killarney hosts Ireland's largest National Park which came to the nation through American generosity.  In my humble opinion the lakes, the trees, the incomparable wildlife and the sense of remoteness make a landscape that is truly magical.  The best way to see it is with a compass, a map and lots of rain clothes and a big wooly jumper.  Stunning countryside.

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks doctorbob, for the additional information about this location.  It certainly is a beautiful spot, even before you get to the cake shop.  We'll add this information to the title the next time we update the record.
